comments: stay away!!! I cant believe she still teaching, I guess Ryerson is that desperate. I have no words to describe her, its one of those things that leave you speechless bcuz you just dont think there\'s people like that on eath...it makes you wonder how somebody like that has gotten thru life. you gotta experience it yourself to know what i\'m saying!

she\'s alright. not a great prof but does know her stuff. pros:tests are fair. she did try her best to teach imo. cons: she\'s unorganized. class fell behind schedule after 1st test, way behind after 3rd. no teaching skills. the course is tough, totally different from fin 501. better have basic knowledge of derivatives before taking this course.
She is below ZERO. Worst prof ever.

worst professor ... not co-operative ... i was about to commit suicide because of her ... v poor teaching skills ... i think ryerson took her .. just because they got no one to teach in the evening .... i have told everyone in my country..on fb n tht ryerson is business minded and does not care for its students... she is ridiculous

Not a helpful prof. In my mind (and others) this class was a waste of time. She could be a great teacher if she wanted to (se expained a few problems when students requested some help)-but no (she prefers easy way out). She wants students to figure out everything themselves. She has very low teaching skills.
Worst prof ever!! Has no clue what she\'s talking about. Makes fun of people. Don\'t take her if you have a choice. I was stuck in her class coz I needed it to graduate.

WORST prof. ever in my 5 years of college/university experience! Hard to understand, takes long to start tests/exam & classes as she calls everyones name for attendance, makes unnecessary rules like must say your last name first or she\'ll scold you. Went into this course expecting A finished w/ C- my lowest grade this yr. (my highest was A+) BEWARE

nice lady,maybe very Knowledgeable, but Definitely not a good teacher. I had been trying very very hard to focus on her class, but I failed. totally wasting time going to her class. I have signed up another course this fall, when I found out she is the professor, I swapped.

I find her quite condescending, esp. when she says the class is easy and we should know the most of the concepts because it\'s a upper-level finance class. Lacked organization and constantly talked during the midterm. Accent quite thick and keeps using examples from other books, which of course you can\'t refer to later on for examples.
difficult tests,unorganized,took her an hour to get the mid term started

Extremely difficult course taught by a confusing woman. Rarely went to class because I couldn\'t follow her due to her accent. She does not clarify what she expects and marks difficult on the assignments. However, it is still better to take this course with her over Terry because her final was pretty easy and she focused on the basic stuff.

She\'s a very nice lady that makes jokes and she\'s liberal about working on the assignments together but she has a very thick accent and is very confusing. She does not explain clearly, skips steps and also makes mathematical errors. Literally half of the students get up and walk out of the class by the break. Nice person but extremely confusing.
